direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve handling and manipulating error codes, with setErrorCode setting the error code and getErrorCode retrieving it.
Both methods involve retrieving error-related information, with getErrorClass retrieving the class part of the error code and getErrorCode retrieving the full error code.
Both methods involve retrieving error-related information, with getErrorNumber retrieving the number part of the error code and getErrorCode retrieving the full error code.
Both methods involve processing error codes, with getDefaultReasonPhrase providing a human-readable description based on the error code.
Both methods involve handling error-related information, with setReasonPhrase setting a human-readable description for the error.

enhanced_by.reason: setErrorCode initializes the error code, which is necessary for getErrorCode to retrieve a valid error code.
setErrorClass initializes the error class, which is part of the error code retrieved by getErrorCode.
setErrorNumber initializes the error number, which is part of the error code retrieved by getErrorCode.
setErrorCode must be invoked before getErrorCode to ensure that the error code is set and retrievable.
getErrorClass can be used to verify the class part of the error code retrieved by getErrorCode.
getErrorNumber can be used to verify the number part of the error code retrieved by getErrorCode.
getDefaultReasonPhrase can be used to verify the human-readable description of the error code retrieved by getErrorCode.
